designScenario.name: Hydraulic Pump
designScenario.description: The Hydraulic Pump is a mission-critical component in modern aircraft, delivering precise hydraulic power for flight control surfaces, landing gear deployment, and emergency systems. It integrates adaptive pressure modulation, thermal resilience for extreme operational environments (-65°C to 200°C), and predictive health monitoring. The design prioritizes redundancy through dual-channel operation, electromagnetic interference (EMI) hardening for avionics compatibility, and lightweight composite materials to reduce overall system mass.

details.description: The pump shall maintain independent primary and secondary pressure channels with automatic failover to ensure uninterrupted hydraulic supply during component degradation.
The system shall adjust flow rates from 5 GPM to 85 GPM within 0.3 seconds to accommodate rapid changes in actuator demand during high-G maneuvers.
Embedded phase-change cooling modules shall limit pump housing temperatures to 150°C maximum during continuous operation, with automatic emergency shutdown at 170°C.
The pump shall incorporate vibration spectroscopy sensors and fluid particulate analysis to enable maintenance intervals based on actual wear instead of fixed flight hours.

systemComponents.name: Hydraulic Pump Core
systemComponents.description: Primary pressure generation unit with dual rotary piston assemblies and integrated smart valving

subComponents.name: Dual-Spool Drive Shaft
subComponents.description: Titanium alloy shaft with harmonic dampeners transmitting mechanical power from multiple drive sources

subComponents.name: Adaptive Plenum Chamber
subComponents.description: Pressure-regulated cavity with shape-memory alloy walls optimizing fluid dynamics across operational envelopes

systemComponents.name: Smart Control Module
systemComponents.description: FPGA-based controller implementing SAE AS5956 protocols for deterministic response in fly-by-wire systems

subComponents.name: Health Monitoring Processor
subComponents.description: AI-accelerated chipset analyzing real-time wear patterns using convolutional neural networks

subComponents.name: EMI-Shielded CAN Bus
subComponents.description: Redundant controller area network interfaces meeting DO-254 Level A compliance

relationships.description: The Smart Control Module is physically encapsulated within the Hydraulic Pump Core's EMI-hardened housing for signal integrity
Requires 28VDC emergency power and 115VAC 400Hz primary power from the aircraft's electrical system
Mechanical linkage between drive shaft kinematics and plenum geometry adjustments

attributes.name: operatingPressure
attributes.description: Extended pressure range supporting next-generation high-load actuators while maintaining 3:1 safety margin

attributes.name: fluidCompatibility
attributes.description: Certified for use with fire-resistant phosphate ester and synthetic hydrocarbon-based hydraulic fluids

attributes.name: weight
attributes.description: Carbon fiber reinforced polymer housing with titanium internals reducing mass by 40% vs legacy systems

attributes.name: MTBF
attributes.description: Mean Time Between Failures calculated per MIL-HDBK-217F under standard operational profiles

attributes.name: shockResistance
attributes.description: Certified to RTCA DO-160 Section 7.3 for crash survivability

aggregations.description: Link between Adaptive Plenum Chamber and Dual-Spool Drive Shaft

requirements.name: DualChannelPressure
requirements.text: Maintain independent primary/secondary pressure channels with automatic failover

requirements.name: DynamicFlowRegulation
requirements.text: Adjust flow rates 5-85 GPM within 0.3 seconds

requirements.name: ThermalRunawayPrevention
requirements.text: Limit housing temp to 150°C with emergency shutdown at 170°C

requirements.name: ConditionBasedMaintenance
requirements.text: Implement vibration spectroscopy and fluid particulate analysis

comments.body: Dual rotary piston assemblies with shape-memory alloy plenum
AI-accelerated wear pattern analysis using CNNs
